cluster.display: The __________ is in the middle of the chest.
The heart is in the __________ of the chest.
The heart is in the middle of the __________.
First the __________ flows into tubes called arteries.
First the blood flows into __________ called arteries.
First the blood flows into tubes called __________.
The __________ that leave the heart are thick tubes.
The arteries that leave the __________ are thick tubes.
The arteries that leave the heart are __________.
The closer to the __________, the fewer the veins there are, and the larger they are.
The closer to the heart, the fewer the __________ there are, and the larger they are.
First moving away from the __________ in the arteries, then traveling to various parts of the body in capillaries, and lastly going back to the __________ through the veins.
First moving away from the heart in the __________, then traveling to various parts of the body in capillaries, and lastly going back to the heart through the veins.
First moving away from the heart in the arteries, then traveling to various parts of the __________ in capillaries, and lastly going back to the heart through the veins.
First moving away from the heart in the arteries, then traveling to various parts of the body in __________, and lastly going back to the heart through the veins.
First moving away from the __________ in the arteries, then traveling to various parts of the body in capillaries, and lastly going back to the __________ through the veins.
First moving away from the heart in the arteries, then traveling to various parts of the body in capillaries, and lastly going back to the heart through the __________.
__________ can flow from the atria down into the ventricles, because there are openings in the horizontal septum that separates them.
Blood can flow from the __________ down into the ventricles, because there are openings in the horizontal septum that separates them.
Blood can flow from the atria down into the __________, because there are openings in the horizontal septum that separates them.
Blood can flow from the atria down into the ventricles, because there are __________ in the horizontal septum that separates them.
Blood can flow from the atria down into the ventricles, because there are openings in the horizontal __________ that separates them.
The __________ is a double pump whose two parts work in unison.
The heart is a double __________ whose two parts work in unison.
The heart is a double pump whose __________ parts work in unison.
The heart is a double pump whose two __________ work in unison.
The heart is a double pump whose two parts work in __________.
__________ can not flow back and forth between the left and right halves of the heart, because the septum that separates them is solid, keeping the two circles separate.
Blood can not flow back and forth between the left and right __________ of the heart, because the septum that separates them is solid, keeping the two circles separate.
Blood can not flow back and forth between the left and right halves of the __________, because the septum that separates them is solid, keeping the two circles separate.
Blood can not flow back and forth between the left and right halves of the heart, because the __________ that separates them is solid, keeping the two circles separate.
Blood can not flow back and forth between the left and right halves of the heart, because the septum that separates them is __________, keeping the two circles separate.
Blood can not flow back and forth between the left and right halves of the heart, because the septum that separates them is solid, keeping the __________ separate.
The left __________ of the heart sends blood out through a big artery and from there, into branching arteries that carry it to various parts of the body.
The left ventricle of the __________ sends blood out through a big artery and from there, into branching arteries that carry it to various parts of the body.
The left ventricle of the heart sends __________ out through a big artery and from there, into branching arteries that carry it to various parts of the body.
The left ventricle of the heart sends blood out through a big artery and from there, into branching __________ that carry it to various parts of the body.
The left ventricle of the heart sends blood out through a big artery and from there, into branching arteries that carry it to __________ of the body.
The left ventricle of the heart sends blood out through a big artery and from there, into branching arteries that carry it to various parts of the __________.
The __________ that carry blood back from the body parts empty the blood into the right atrium of the heart.
The veins that carry __________ back from the body parts empty the __________ into the right atrium of the heart.
The veins that carry blood back from the __________ empty the blood into the right atrium of the heart.
The veins that carry __________ back from the body parts empty the __________ into the right atrium of the heart.
The veins that carry blood back from the body parts empty the blood into the __________ of the heart.
The veins that carry blood back from the body parts empty the blood into the right atrium of the __________.
The __________ then flows down into the right ventricle, which pumps it into the lungs and back to the heart, into the left atrium.
The blood then flows down into the right ventricle, which pumps it into the __________ and back to the heart, into the left atrium.
The blood then flows down into the right ventricle, which pumps it into the lungs and back to the __________, into the left atrium.
From there the __________ flows into the left ventricle,where it is once again pumped out into the body.
From there the blood flows into the left ventricle,where it is once again pumped out into the __________.
It brings __________ to the body cells and takes away their carbon dioxide.
It brings oxygen to the body cells and takes away their __________.
As the __________ flows through the capillaries in the body, carrying its supply of oxygen, it also collects carbon dioxide.
As the blood flows through the capillaries in the __________, carrying its supply of oxygen, it also collects carbon dioxide.
As the blood flows through the capillaries in the body, carrying its __________ of oxygen, it also collects carbon dioxide.
As the blood flows through the capillaries in the body, carrying its supply of oxygen, it also collects __________.
The __________ is then pumped into the right ventricle, and then to the lungs.
The blood is then pumped into the __________, and then to the lungs.
The blood is then pumped into the right ventricle, and then to the __________.
__________ from the heart flows through these capillaries, passing carbon dioxide into the tiny air sacs.
Blood from the __________ flows through these capillaries, passing carbon dioxide into the tiny air sacs.
Blood from the heart flows through these __________, passing carbon dioxide into the tiny air sacs.
Blood from the heart flows through these capillaries, passing __________ into the tiny air sacs.
Blood from the heart flows through these capillaries, passing carbon dioxide into the __________.
The oxygen-rich __________ is returned to the left atrium of the heart and pumped out to the body through the left ventricle.
The oxygen-rich blood is returned to the left atrium of the __________ and pumped out to the body through the left ventricle.
The oxygen-rich blood is returned to the left atrium of the heart and pumped out to the __________ through the left ventricle.
The oxygen-rich blood is returned to the left atrium of the heart and pumped out to the body through the __________.
The __________ starts with the atria, which push blood into the ventricles.
The contraction starts with the __________, which push blood into the ventricles.
The contraction starts with the atria, which push __________ into the ventricles.
The contraction starts with the atria, which push blood into the __________.
Then the __________ of the ventricles squeeze together and force the blood out into the arteries.
Then the walls of the __________ squeeze together and force the blood out into the arteries.
Then the walls of the ventricles squeeze together and force the __________ out into the arteries.
Then the walls of the ventricles squeeze together and force the blood out into the __________.
The __________ is the first part of the heartbeat.
The contraction is the __________ of the heartbeat.
The contraction is the first part of the __________.
After that, the heart __________ relaxes, which is the second part of the heartbeat.
After that, the heart muscle relaxes, which is the second __________ of the heartbeat.
After that, the heart muscle relaxes, which is the second part of the __________.
__________ can not flow backward into the arteries because little trapdoors called valves stop it.
Blood can not flow backward into the __________ because little trapdoors called valves stop it.
Blood can not flow backward into the arteries because little __________ called valves stop it.
Blood can not flow backward into the arteries because little trapdoors called __________ stop it.
Age?
Gender?
Which is the highest level of education you have completed?
Did you have a high school Biology class?
How many college Biology classes have you taken?
